quoteLast: = It is no use--I have to acknowledge defeat. Born with such a Jekyll-and-Hyde disposition that I am never normal, either so filled with ideals that everything good and noble seems possible, or so black that I shrink from myself in horror--even though it has been in thought rather than deed that I have transgressed or been an idealist.
title: The Glebe 1913/11 (Vol. 1, No. 2): Diary of a Suicide
